summary: This document is a series of emails from August 28, 2019, between personnel at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY). The emails discuss obtaining approval for travel to Palm Beach, Florida, the following week to conduct a proffer session with a witness (name redacted) as part of the ongoing investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's co-conspirators. The travel is also intended to potentially meet with victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as the central figure whose co-conspirators are under investigation by the SDNY.

events.title: Previous victim meeting
events.description: The SDNY team met with victims, which was described as very helpful to the ongoing investigation.

events.title: Planned travel for proffer session
events.description: SDNY prosecutors plan to travel to Palm Beach to conduct a proffer session with a witness regarding the investigation into Epstein's co-conspirators.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein's co-conspirators in August 2019.
Prosecutors had recently met with victims, who were described as 'very grateful'.
The office sought and received approval to travel to Palm Beach, Florida, for a proffer session with a witness the following week.
The emails indicate the investigation was ongoing and involved coordinating travel and conference room bookings for witness interviews.
Key names of prosecutors or witnesses are redacted in the document text.
